intro: Capparis jamaicensis f. longifolia, commonly known as the Jamaican caper, is a shrub native to the Caribbean region. It is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces edible, green berries that are often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly serrated margin. The species is adapted to coastal environments and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils.
